Authors:
Alireza Poursafar, youbert Ghosta, Mohammad
Javan-Nikkhah
Title:
Alternaria ershadii sp. nov. a new species isolated from
wheat black head mold in Iran
Keywords:
sooty mold, new species, phylogenetic analysis, cereals,
Pseudoalternaria
Abstract:
In a continuation of studies on Alternaria species from
wheat plants with black head mold symptoms, several isolates with
typical characteristics of the section Pseudoalternaria were isolated
and studied by a combined approach based on morphological
characteristics and phylogenetic analyses using sequence data of
ITS-nrDNA, GAPDH and plasma membrane ATPase genes. These isolates
present a new and previously undescribed species in this section which
is illustrated and described here as Alternaria ershadii. Based on our
phylogenetic studies, four species viz.Â Alternaria arrhenatheri, A.
kordkuyana, A. parvicaespitosa and A. rosae can be placed in this
section, but A. brassicifolii, which is recently described from Brassica
rapa subsp. pekinensis in Korea and placed in this section, is formed a
well separated monotypic lineage distinct from the members of this
section. Comparisons with other species in the section Pseudoalternaria
are provided.
